intro: Agathosma viscida, commonly known as the sticky agathosma, is a succulent shrub native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its fleshy stems and leaves. Its sticky resin, which gives it its common name, has been traditionally used for medicinal purposes. Agathosma viscida is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and resilience.
